newsitem.title: JAPAN: Marubeni to invest up to $150 mln in RR programme.
newsitem.headline: Marubeni to invest up to $150 mln in RR programme.

text.p: Japanese trading house Marubeni Corp said on Wednesday that it may invest between $100 million and $150 million in Rolls-Royce Plc's Trent aircraft engine programme.

Marubeni said it had joined eight other risk- and revenue-sharing partners already in the programme who will receive revenues from the sale of the engines depending on their share of the total investment in the programme.
Marubeni has been the agency for Rolls-Royce's airplane engines in Japan since 1992, but has not won any orders from Japanese airlines.
The Marubeni spokesman said the new contract would enable the company to expand its marketing operations to other parts of Asia.
Rolls-Royce currently holds about a 50 percent share in the private-sector airline engine market in the Asia-Pacific region, the company said in a statement.
